TABLE.NAME: tool_mergeusers_queue
TABLE.COMMENT: List of users merging request: data from removeuservalue user is merged into keepuservalue user.

FIELD.NAME: removeuserfield
FIELD.COMMENT: Data from this user field (removeuserfield) will be merged into the keepuserid.

FIELD.NAME: removeuservalue
FIELD.COMMENT: Data from this user value (removeuservalue) will be merged into the keepuserid.

FIELD.NAME: removeuserid
FIELD.COMMENT: Data from this user id (removeuserid) will be merged into the keepuserid.

FIELD.NAME: keepuserfield
FIELD.COMMENT: User that will remain with data of both users.

FIELD.NAME: keepuservalue
FIELD.COMMENT: User that will remain with data of both users.

FIELD.NAME: keepuserid
FIELD.COMMENT: User that will remain with data of both users.

FIELD.NAME: timeadded
FIELD.COMMENT: Time stamp when the merging request was added to the queue.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time stamp when the merging request status has beeen updated.

FIELD.NAME: retries
FIELD.COMMENT: Number of retries to merge user accounts.

FIELD.NAME: log
FIELD.COMMENT: List of actions performed if success, or errors on merging failure.

INDEX.NAME: mdl_toolmerg_tcs_ix
INDEX.COMMENT: When listing the queue you probably would like to see the last updated or the last created to see how it went. Without indexes, that listing would be very expensive.

INDEX.NAME: mdl_toolmerg_tms_ix
INDEX.COMMENT: When listing the queue you probably would like to see the last updated or the last created to see how it went. Without indexes, that listing would be very expensive.
